Use the following settings to create a new Gymnasium course in Studio.


Setting up a New Course


Default Course Settings




Course Name: 
[Full Name] e.g. Coding for Designers


Organization: 
Gymnasium


Course Number: 
[Course ID] e.g. 100


Course Run: 
0






Note


All new courses launch with 
Course Run
 set to 0. This value increments when the course is relaunched.




Course Team


Add admin users to the course team:




josborn@aquent.com


amiller@aquent.com


mbifulco@aquent.com




Add Catalog Content




Course Details


Course Artwork


Instructor Bio


Instructor Photo






Note




Refer to the Gymnasium Assets Site for content


The document with 
My Progress
 in the title for the course outline


edX concepts translated to Gymnasium


Section = Lesson


Subsection = Chapter


Unit = Video or Assessment

docs.text:
General Usage


Fenced Code Blocks


Inline Code






Using Code in Assessments






General Usage


Language-specific text highlighting is implemented with 
prism.js
. To embed a code snippet in Gymnasium content, wrap it in 
pre
 and 
code
 tags and specify the 
language
 for syntax highlighting.


Fenced Code Blocks


This code snippet:


pre

    
code class=
language-javascript

    function myTestFunction(x,y) {
        return x * y;
    }
    
/code


/pre





Would appear like this in Gymnasium:


    function myTestFunction(x,y) {
        return x * y;
    }




Inline Code


Inline code snippets work the same way - simply remove any extraneous whitespace. For example, this snippet: 


You can use 
pre
code class="language-javascript"
console.log()
/code
/pre
 to debug your code!


Would appear like this in Gymnasium:


You can use 
console.log()
 to debug your code!


To embed a code snippet in a multiple choice problem you wrap it in 
pre
 and 
code
 tags and specify the language for syntax highlighting.


pre

    
code class=
language-css

    body {
        margin: 0
    }
    
/code


/pre





Using Code in Assessments




Warning


This section is incomplete!




Example of a standard multiple choice problem:


1. Select a choice below. The correct answer should be very evident.

     ( ) incorrect
     ( ) impossible
     (x) correct 
     ( ) inaccurate

[explanation]
This is a helpful explanation of the correct answer.
[explanation]




Example using code snippets for answer choices:


1. Select a choice below. The correct answer should be very evident.

     ( ) 
pre
code class=
language-javascript
printf.out()
/code
/pre

     ( ) 
pre
code class=
language-javascript
serial.write()
/code
/pre

     (x) 
pre
code class=
language-javascript
console.log()
/code
/pre

     ( ) 
pre
code class=
language-javascript
output.send()
/code
/pre


[explanation]
This is a helpful explanation of the correct answer.
[explanation]
docs.title: Syntax Highlighting

docs.text: Language-specific text highlighting is implemented with  prism.js . To embed a code snippet in Gymnasium content, wrap it in  pre  and  code  tags and specify the  language  for syntax highlighting.

Warning  This section is incomplete!   Example of a standard multiple choice problem:  1. Select a choice below. The correct answer should be very evident. 
     ( ) incorrect
     ( ) impossible
     (x) correct 
     ( ) inaccurate

[explanation]
This is a helpful explanation of the correct answer.
[explanation]  Example using code snippets for answer choices:  1. Select a choice below. The correct answer should be very evident. 
     ( )  pre code class= language-javascript printf.out() /code /pre 
     ( )  pre code class= language-javascript serial.write() /code /pre 
     (x)  pre code class= language-javascript console.log() /code /pre 
     ( )  pre code class= language-javascript output.send() /code /pre 

[explanation]
This is a helpful explanation of the correct answer.
[explanation]
